meanings.sent1: She effectuated her plan to clean the house by organizing a schedule.
meanings.sent2: The new manager effectuated positive changes in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The cat effectuated chaos by knocking over all the flower vases.
meanings.sent4: His speech effectuated a wave of inspiration among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The magician effectuated a stunning illusion that left everyone amazed.

meanings.definition: To cause to happen or occur
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather effectuated a change in our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise effectuated a sudden reaction from the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guest effectuated a flurry of activity in the house.
meanings.sent4: His absence effectuated a sense of emptiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock effectuated an early start to the day.
